name: Rhossili Bay
best_for: Best for views, surfing and walking.
description: Regularly voted Britain's best beach. 3-mile curve of golden sand beneath Rhossili Down. Worm's Head at south end. Spectacular any season.

name: Barafundle Bay
best_for: Best for beauty, seclusion and swimming.
description: Often called Wales's best-kept secret (it's not secret anymore). Worth every step of the walk in. No facilities - bring everything.

name: Three Cliffs Bay
best_for: Best for photography, walking and swimming.
description: Wales's most photographed beach. Three limestone pinnacles frame the bay. River crossing required at most tides. Magical at sunset.

name: Whitesands Bay
best_for: Best for surfing, families and St Davids.
description: Pembrokeshire's premier family beach near St Davids. Blue Flag, lifeguards, surf school. Gets busy but well-organised. Purple sandpipers in winter.

name: Newborough Beach (Llanddwyn)
best_for: Best for walking, Llanddwyn Island and views.
description: Vast beach with views to Snowdonia. Llanddwyn Island at south end is magical. Romantic legend and lighthouse ruins. Allow whole day.

name: Tenby North Beach
best_for: Best for families, town beach and facilities.
description: Classic seaside town beach beneath colourful Georgian houses. All facilities. Castle Beach around headland for more space. Caldey Island boats.

name: Freshwater West
best_for: Best for surfing, wildness and Harry Potter.
description: Wild and powerful. Featured in Harry Potter (Shell Cottage). Strong currents - not for casual swimming. Dune system behind. Atmospheric any weather.

name: Broad Haven
best_for: Best for families, village and facilities.
description: Classic Pembrokeshire family beach with village behind. Reliable facilities and gentle waters. Rock pools at low tide. Gateway to coast path walks.

name: Oxwich Bay
best_for: Best for families, nature reserve and dunes.
description: Sweeping bay with nature reserve behind. More sheltered than west Gower beaches. Good for families wanting space and facilities. Dune walks excellent.

name: Mwnt
best_for: Best for dolphins, seclusion and beauty.
description: Tiny perfect cove with whitewashed church above. Dolphins frequently seen. Steep steps to beach. National Trust - arrive early in summer.

name: Llangrannog
best_for: Best for village, coast path and families.
description: Charming village beach squeezed between cliffs. Coast path access to quieter coves north and south. Traditional seaside atmosphere.

name: Porth Oer (Whistling Sands)
best_for: Best for squeaky sand, unique and sheltered.
description: Sand squeaks underfoot due to grain shape. North-facing so sheltered from prevailing winds. National Trust managed. Magical atmosphere.

name: Llandudno West Shore
best_for: Best for promenade, families and Great Orme.
description: Quiet alternative to main beach. Views to Conwy and Snowdonia. Great Orme backdrop. Good for paddling and kite flying.

name: Harlech Beach
best_for: Best for castle views, dunes and space.
description: Vast beach beneath dramatic castle. Royal St David's golf course behind dunes. Usually uncrowded despite scale. Spectacular sunsets.

name: Abersoch Main Beach
best_for: Best for village, watersports and families.
description: Popular resort beach with full facilities. Sailing and watersports hub. Can be very busy in summer. Sheltered from west winds.
